children.subject: Not at this time since I have to stop & manually copy/paste from each class to create that post. If I have time to do that at the beginning of the adjustment period, I will but no promises. Remember that I'm one person responsible for enrollments of thousands of students. This definitely falls into the lower-priority list of tasks.
That makes a lot of sense! I wonder if this problem can be solved with software however - simple web scraper that copies all the class notes and puts them into one text file
I like the way you think. Since adding the info as class notes is a recent development, we hadn't gotten to thinking about how to consolidate it.

I already built a tool to scrape all CS course information from classes.berkeley.edu. If you would like, I could modify that slightly to consolidate the enrollment information and post it on this piazza.
That would be great! Why don't we take this convo offline to work out details. Email me @ csconners@berkeley.edu.  Thanks!

While adding the information to Class Notes does seem more official, I personally gained a lot of value from seeing all the upperdiv enrollment information in one place - is there any way to view all the class notes of each of the cs course in one place? (instead of searching for each course, opening them up, clicking read more on each page, etc)

history.content: This semester, I've added enrollment information as CLASS NOTES section of the class detail page on classes.berkeley.edu.
